newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong stocks rise in morning after Fed meeting.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks rise in morning after Fed meeting.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks moved higher in Wednesday morning trade after the U.S. Federal Reserve decided to leave interest rates unchanged at its policy meeting on Tuesday.
The Hang Seng index rose 34.16 points to 11,346.67. Turnover was HK$1.51 billion after the first fifty minutes of trade.

"Uncertainty as to whether or not there will be a rate hike has been moved aside. We have broken through 11,200. That now will be created as a support level," said Miles Remington, sales trader at Crosby Securities.
"There is a general confidence within this market that we will see positive news on both Cheung Kong and Hutchison," Remington added.
Cheung Kong (Holdings) and Hutchison Whampoa are due to release interim results on Thursday. Cheung Kong shares were steady at HK$56.50 and Hutchison rose HK$0.10 to HK$48.70.
Analysts said however that the Federal Reserve's decision to leave interest rates unchanged was widely expected and the Hang Seng index may have trouble sustaining this week's gains.
"I think it will be a problem trying to sustain the market above 11,300," said one trader. "We really have to convince ourselves that we are going to trade up again or we will go sideways."
The Hang Seng index closed above 11,300 points on Tuesday for the first time since March, rising 99.03 points to 11,312.51.
"I think you have had a very good run. The market is probably due for a correction in the next few days," said Remington.
Shares in Guangdong Investment Ltd rose HK$0.20 to HK$5.55.

Guangdong Investment parent Guangdong Enterprises said it would place 80 million existing shares of its unit with private investors at HK$5.22 per share, before subscribing to the same amount of new shares at the same price.

Utility shares continued to rally after the Hang Seng utilities sub-index gained 2.17 percent on Tuesday. China Light rose HK$0.20 to HK$33.50 and Hongkong Electric added HK$0.20 to HK$23.50. Hong Kong and China Gas rose HK$0.10 to HK$12.65 and Hongkong Telecom rose HK$0.10 to HK$13.20.
